intro: Lophostachys guatemalensis, commonly known as the Guatemalan chenopod, is a shrub native to Central America. It belongs to the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, branching stems and small, scale-like leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny, greenish flowers that are often hidden among the foliage. It is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient species in dry conditions. Lophostachys guatemalensis is often found in rocky soils and is used in traditional medicine by local communities.
